content.description: Wide corner and crack system with blocky rock at the top. Mike Williams' guidebook rates this at 5.6, but that's way off. The top-most portion is at least 5.9 if not harder. The route is dirty and not worth the trouble.
content.protection: No anchor. Big oak at the top is rotten. Had to build anchor about 20 feet away.

content.description: Follow the finger and hand crack to the top.  It's worth doing.  A good 5.8 for a trad climber who is breaking into the grade.
content.protection: Finger and hand size pieces.  You can place lots of gear.
content.location: This route is the first you will come to if you continue upstream from the Bimbo Buttress.  It's not a far walk and if you are looking for moderates, you can add this to your day at the Bimbo Buttress.

content.description: Climb the arete and face to the right of a wide crack.  There's nothing too significant about this climb, but worth doing if you are in the area.
content.location: If you came to this area to do Peanut Bubba and Jam or The Icon of Control, you might as well do this too.  Start just to the right of Icon of Control.

content.description: Climb the face, past a bolt(crux) to reach a roof.  Continue to the top.  Fun face moves, feels pretty sporty.
content.protection: Horizontals take excellent gear.  1 bolt. Bolted anchor.
content.location: This route is just to the right of Peanut Bubba and Jam.  It's easily toproped after doing PB&J.

content.description: A fun line that has one a great roof pull at the second/third bolt. Big move to get you into a delicate cruxy face that guards the anchors.
content.location: Look for a bulge that goes up to a low roof. The route is around the corner from Learning Curve, it is the next bolted route right of Learning Curve
